subhed: French authorities had announced the arrest of two suspects and, a few days later, prosecutors said that police had arrested five more people, including a prime suspect. The five detentions took place in and around the French capital.

title: Western Sahara: Morocco secures diplomatic victory at the UN
byline: By Alexandre Aublanc (Casablanca (Morocco), correspondent) and Frédéric Bobin
subhed: The United Nations Security Council adopted a resolution on Friday that recognizes Rabat's autonomy plan as the main reference point in the search for a solution to a conflict that has long poisoned the geopolitics of North Africa.

title: A dizzying dive into Bob Wilson's Long Island theater of objects
subhed: Famous for his groundbreaking shows, the American stage director, who died this summer at the age of 83, was also a great lover of art and design. A compulsive collector of chairs, which he created for his productions, he left behind thousands of works gathered throughout his life, spread between his Manhattan loft-studio, storage warehouses and the Water Mill art center, which he founded on Long Island.

title: Sentences over red hand graffiti on Paris Shoah Memorial handed down in 'unprecedented' trial
subhed: Four Bulgarian nationals, one of whom is still at large, received sentences ranging from two to four years in prison amid suspicions of foreign interference. The damage was committed 'because the victim belonged to a particular religion,' according to the Paris Criminal Court.

Egypt opens Grand Egyptian Museum, centerpiece of its tourism industry
byline: By Eliott Brachet (Cairo (Egypt) correspondent) and Samuel Forey
subhed: The colossal project dates back to the 1990s. The huge site, next to the pyramids of Giza, is billed as the largest museum in the world dedicated to a single civilization. It opens on November 1 after years of delays.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhed: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

title: Madagascar's new government faces scrutiny from Gen Z
subhed: President Michaël Randrianirina announced the 28 members of the government on Tuesday, October 28. Opposition leaders to the ousted regime, newcomers and technocrats now have 60 days to deliver results.
